p: In the context of this historical opportunity to cure HCV infections, achieve large reductions in disease burden, and even eliminate this blood‐borne virus as a public health concern, the World Health Organization (WHO) formulated the Global Health Sector Strategy on Viral Hepatitis, 2016‐2021 (GHSS) 22 and established service coverage targets to eliminate HCV as a public health threat by 2030. 22, 23 The strategy specifically calls for scaling up testing and treatment to achieve by 2030 target coverage levels of 90% for HCV diagnosis, 80% for HCV treatment, as well as 80% reduction in HCV incidence. 4, 22, 23
